bones.name: Ethmoid obne
bones.fact: The ethmoid bone serves as a supporting structure within the skull.

bones.name: Forehead
bones.fact: The frontal sinuses are located in the frontal bone and contribute to nasal cavity function.

bones.name: Jugal bone
bones.fact: The jugal bone is thin, strut-like and reduces skull weight and aid in cranial movement.

bones.name: Left teeth
bones.fact: Teeth are not considered bones, but instead hard issue primarily designed for chewing.

bones.name: Tear bone
bones.fact: Lacrimal bones are small, paried bones locataed in the medial wall of each eye socket.

bones.name: Lower jaw bone
bones.fact: The mandible is the only moveable bone in the skull.

bones.name: Upper jaw bone
bones.fact: The maxilla supports the upper teeth and forms the roof of the mouth.

bones.name: nasal bone
bones.fact: The nasal bones fuse to protect the nasal carity from external elements.

bones.name: Turbinate
bones.fact: The nasal cochae is responsible for warming and humidifying the air before it enters the lungs.

bones.name: Occipital bone
bones.fact: The occipital bone is known as C0 and protects the cerebellum and occipital lobes of the brain.

bones.name: Skull Cap
bones.fact: This is the upper part of the cranium that encloses and protects the brain.

bones.name: Parietal bone
bones.fact: Palatine bones contribute to the hard palate and floor of the nasal cavity.

bones.name: Incisive bone
bones.fact: The premaxilla bone contributes to the facial skeleton and supports the incisors.

bones.name: Wedge bone
bones.fact: The sphenoid bone is a complex, butterfly-shaped bone that contributes to the forming of the skull base, orbits, and nasal cavity.

bones.name: Teeth
bones.fact: Callithrix marmosets have enlarged mandibular incisors to gouge trees.

bones.name: Temporal bone
bones.fact: Temporal bones form part of the lateral skull base and house the structures of the middle and inner ear.

bones.name: Vomer bone
bones.fact: The vomer bone is a single flat bone located in the midline of the skull in the nasal cavity.
